Situation1: A heated dispute has escalated to the point where they are questioning staying together.
Expectation2: Participate in project planning and provide accurate time estimates
Situation2: A binding client contract cannot be finalized until they provide precise effort estimates
Story: I sat on the edge of my bed, phone pressed to my ear, my boyfriend’s voice trembling with frustration. Our argument had spiraled out of control, and now he was questioning if we should even stay together. My heart pounded as I tried to find the right words to calm him, to resolve the conflict before it tore us apart. But my laptop chimed insistently—my team was waiting for me in a video call. The client needed my project estimates tonight, or the contract would fall through. My manager had already messaged twice, reminding me how crucial my input was. I felt pulled in two directions, my mind racing with the weight of both expectations. I wanted to be present for him, to fix what was breaking between us, but I also knew my team was counting on me. My hands shook as I stared at the screen, torn between the person I loved and the career I’d worked so hard to build.
